required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of SH T00658ID as Compared to a Monophasic Contraceptive Containing Ethinylestradiol and Levonorgestrel (SH D01155E) on Hemostatic Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-centre, Open-label, Crossover, Controlled, Randomized Study to Investigate the Impact of SH T00658ID as Compared to a Monophasic Contraceptive Containing Ethinylestradiol and Levonorgestrel (SH D01155E) on Hemostatic Parameters in 30 Healthy Female Volunteers Over 3 Treatment Cycles

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the impact of SH T00658ID (EV/DNG tablet) on hemostatic parameters in comparison to a reference oral contraceptive (OC) (SH D01155E) in a crossover design.

detailed_description.textblock: The study has previously been posted by Schering AG, Germany. Schering AG, Germany has been renamed to Bayer Schering Pharma AG, Germany.Bayer Schering Pharma AG, Germany is the sponsor of the trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Intraindividual absolute changes from Baseline in the Parameters of thrombin and fibrin turnover
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Cycle 3 of each treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraindividual absolute changes from Baseline in Pro- and anti-coagulatory parameters and the parameter of thrombin and fibrin turnover (activation marker): Prothrombin (Factor II).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Cycle 3 of each treatment period
2 treatment periods (3 cycles each), 2 cycles whash out-period and 14 days follow-up period

intervention.description: per cycle (28 days): Days 1-2: 3.0 mg EV; Days 3-7: 2.0 mg EV + 2.0 mg DNG; Days 824: 2.0 mg EV + 3.0 mg DNG; Days 25-26: 1.0 mg EV; Days 27-28: Placebo
per cycle: Days 1-21: 0.03 mg EE + 0.15 mg LNG; Days 22-28: Placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy female volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Any condition that might interfere with the outcome as all contraindications for OC use.

Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

results_reference.citation: Klipping C, Duijkers I, Parke S, Mellinger U, Serrani M, Junge W. Hemostatic effects of a novel estradiol-based oral contraceptive: an open-label, randomized, crossover study of estradiol valerate/dienogest versus ethinylestradiol/levonorgestrel. Drugs R D. 2011;11(2):159-70. doi: 10.2165/11591200-000000000-00000.
